messages.subject: Community College requirements
messages.msgSnippet: It s basically the same in Texas.  All students take the  Accuplacer (used to be THEA).  It covers math, reading and writing. Everyone takes it unless they
messages.messageBody:
It's basically the same in Texas. All students take the Accuplacer
(used to be THEA). It covers math, reading and writing. Everyone takes it
unless they score over a certain number on their TAKS tests, Texas'
standardized testing given all through Elementary-High school. (have to be
passed to graduate)

My older kids all graduated or got their GED, which was required for
admittance.
Haven't had the experience of entering as homeschooler yet.

Embracing His grace,
Dena

*Deuteronomy 28:12*
*"The LORD will open for you His good storehouse, the heavens,*
*to give rain to your land in its season and to bless all the work of your
hand;*
*
*
*
*


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
